ProcedureHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: PROC METADATA <server-connection-arguments>
    IN = "XML-formatted-method-call" | fileref  <OUT = fileref>  
    <HEADER = NONE | SIMPLE | FULL>  <VERBOSE>;  

The METADATA procedure sends an XML string to the SAS Metadata Server. The XML string, 
which you specify with the IN= argument, contains a method call. You form the method 
call as if you were submitting it with the inMetadata parameter of the DoRequest method. 
These methods are all part of the SAS Open Metadata Interface.

ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: PASSWORD="password"] 
      
Is the password for the authenticated user ID on the metadata server.

[Syntax: PORT=number] 
      
Is the TCP port that the metadata server listens to for requests.
Specifies the network protocol for connecting to the metadata server.

[Syntax: REPOSITORY= "name"] 
      
Is the name of the SAS Metadata Repository to use when resolving the $METAREPOSITORY 
substitution variable.

[Syntax: SERVER="host-name"] 
      
Is the host name or network IP address of the computer that hosts the metadata server.

[Syntax: USER="authenticated-user-ID"] 
      
Is an authenticated user ID on the metadata server.
Specifies an encoding declaration for the output XML.

ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Omits an encoding declaration. Web browsers and parsers might not handle national language characters appropriately.
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Inserts the static header <?xml version=1.0?>, which instructs the Web browser or parser to detect the encoding
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: Creates an XML declaration that specifies the SAS session encoding.

ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: IN= "XML-formatted-method-call" | fileref] 
      
Specifies an XML-formatted method call, or specifies an XML file that contains the method.

[Syntax: OUT=fileref] 
      
Specifies an XML file in which to store the output that is returned by the metadata server.
Specifies to print the input XML string after it has been through preprocessing.
